question: Nowadays we can see definite signs of surplus production in almost every industry sector, and this is leading to environmental damage. What are some possible solutions to this situation?
text: Some problems; river pollution, waste disposal and sanitation are localised issues that can be effectively managed by the local government’s timely actions. At the same time, it is the responsibility of the local authority to educate their own people about pollution, conservation of energy and the  importance of protecting the nature by recycling. Local residents should be responsible for their actions. Apart from this, the government can introduce better public transport, aiming to help reduce gas emissions must be done domestically.

The first and foremost  thing is that school children are educated regarding  the significance of conservation of energy and various methods are available for this.  Apart from this, unsold and remaining food items should be distributed to needy people. Similarly, food wastes are composted properly and can be used as a fertilizer to replenish the quality of soil. The local government must educate their own people and encourage them to use renewable sources of energy: solar power, tidal energy and wind mills. Additionally, instruct them to use products which are environmentally friendly.
